ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic components and computation of bioimaging methods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Very good class and excellent teaching. Problem sets are reasonable and professors are very helpful.
It would be better if feedback can be faster.
Lectured by different instructors with various areas of expertise. A great blend of biosensing knowledge.

Strengths: Good variety of instructors to teach on different materials

Weaknesses: Prior knowledge of medical imaging was assumed, No clear learning objectives, Exam and homeworks were very out of date and were often written by different people than who lectured on that material

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, very useful class. Heavy content on MRI compared to other sensing modalities.
Yes, you learn a lot in this class
I highly recommend this course if you would like to learn about bioimage.
No. The lectures were rather hard to follow and the homework was largely separate from what was discussed in class. Without prior knowledge of medical imaging it was very confusing and difficult.
